byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and JESS BIDGOOD

abstract: William G Porter is first member of Baltimore Police Dept to take stand in trial of six officers charged in death of Freddie Gray; tells jury he assumed Gray was faking his injuries, and did not suspect his life was in danger; Porter, who is black and grew up in city, faces manslaughter charges.
lead_paragraph: The testimony of Officer William G. Porter, on trial for manslaughter in Baltimore, followed that of a forensic pathologist who testified that Mr. Gray’s death was an accident, not a homicide.

headline.main: Officer Takes Stand in Freddie Gray Case
headline.print_headline: First Officer Takes Stand in Baltimore Police Trial

snippet: The testimony of Officer William G. Porter, on trial for manslaughter in Baltimore, followed that of a forensic pathologist who testified that Mr. Gray’s death was an accident, not a homicide.
